metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4206 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the QXL display device emulation in QEMU. An integeroverflow in the cursor_alloc() function can lead to the allocation of asmall cursor object followed by a subsequent heap-based buffer overflow.This flaw allows a malicious privileged guest user to crash the QEMUprocess on the host or potentially execute arbitrary code within thecontext of the QEMU process.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-block-extra - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-guest-agent - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-kvm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-arm - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-common - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-mips - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-misc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-ppc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-s390x - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-sparc - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-system-x86 - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-user - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-user-binfmt - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-user-static - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
qemu-utils - 1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.11+dfsg-1ubuntu7.40').
